errors.error_description: Installation steps are in wrong logical order - dependencies should be installed after cloning and setting up virtual environment
correction_candidates: To get started, first clone the repository, then set up your virtual environment, and finally install all Python dependencies
To get started, first set up your virtual environment, then clone the repository, and finally install all Python dependencies
To get started, first clone the repository, then install all Python dependencies, and finally set up your virtual environment for development
To get started, first ensure you have Python installed, then clone the repository, set up your virtual environment, and finally install all dependencies
errors.golden_answer: To get started, first clone the repository, then set up your virtual environment, and finally install all Python dependencies

errors.error_description: Specifies very old versions of numpy and requests that may have security vulnerabilities and compatibility issues
correction_candidates: For installation, make sure you have numpy>=1.21.0 and requests>=2.28.0 installed, as these versions provide the latest security updates and compatibility with modern Python versions
For installation, make sure you have the latest versions of numpy and requests installed by running `pip install --upgrade numpy requests`
For installation, make sure you have numpy>=1.20.0 and requests>=2.27.0 installed, which are the minimum recommended versions for security and stability
For installation, install the dependencies using `pip install -r requirements.txt` which will automatically install the correct versions of numpy and requests
errors.golden_answer: For installation, make sure you have numpy>=1.21.0 and requests>=2.28.0 installed, as these versions provide the latest security updates and compatibility with modern Python versions
